img.alt: New Dawn Charter Schools Home Page

h2.span: News, Announcements, and Media Press Releases

div.h3: Announcement: Virtual Learning is in Session - Spring Break Cancelled

div.p: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, we are open and available to students and staff via virtual learning on Thursday, April 9th and Friday, April 10th. Please take these days if you are observing the holidays, but remote instruction will continue.

Following the advice of the NYC Department of Education, we have cancelled Spring Break which was scheduled for was April 13-17, 2020. Staff and students are expected to maintain their assignments through remote instruction during this time.

div.h3: Newly Created Updates and Shout-Outs from Staff

div.p: Thank you New Dawn Students, Staff, and Families for your dedication and hard work as we transitioned from in-person classes to remote and on-line learning.
Please remember that your mentors will be checking in on you, and that it is necessary that you are logging in to JupiterEd.com for classwork, announcements, and assignments.
We wanted to make sure that you have easy access to COVID-19 information and resources, as well as reminders that our staff and dedicated team from both locations miss you and care about you deeply.
Please check this section of our website: http://www.ndchsbrooklyn.org/corona_virus_information_and_updates

div.h3: Corona Virus (CO-VID 19) Information and Resources from New York City

div.p: As of March 13, 2020, both New Dawn Charter Schools are open and in session. In this time, we would like to provide our parents and families with helpful information about the virus, precautions you can take to stay healthy, and support our community.

Brooklyn and Jamaica schools will be closing at 2:00 p.m. for professional development and thorough cleaning of both facilities for the next 48 hours. Check back frequently for updates and information as it is on-going.
Remember, we are in this together and owe it to everyone to practice safe hygiene, self-care, and we are here to maintain a healthy environment, physically and mentally.
Recommendations as we continue as a community:
Wash your hands with soap and water for a minimum of 20 seconds.
Cover your mouth when you cough, sneeze, or yawn.

If any of your students or family members are known to be ill or have symptoms described in the attachments, please be sure to stay home. Absences are not being affected in New York City for students.
It is all of our responsibility to limit exposure, but also to be realistic and compassionate about those around us.
Text: To get regular updates on the latest developments regarding Coronavirus in New York City, text COVID to 692-692. You will receive regular SMS texts with the latest news and developments.
NYC DOE Health and Wellness Updates on the Corona Virus and List of Those Impacted - this site is updated daily.

li.a: Coron Virus Update for Families in Spanish.pdf

div.h3: New York City Department of Education Coronavirus Updates

div.p: Please see the New York City Department of Education - Coronavirus updates in order to stay informed.
"As a reminder, it is critical that all New Yorkers continue to practice general viral infection prevention measures including:

ul.li: Cover your cough or sneeze with a tissue or sleeve
Avoid close contact with people who are sick
Get your flu shot—it’s never too late
Stay home if you’re feeling sick. Call your doctor and let them know your symptoms and travel history."

div.p: Check back frequently for updates.

p.a: New York City DOE - Coronavirus Updates

div.h3: 2019 Senior Dinner

div.p: Graduating Seniors from the class of 2019 attended a dinner at Hotel Chantelle in New York City. Music, dancing, and family-style cuisine were all on the menu for the event. A fabulous evening was had by all who attended. See you at the Senior Breakfast on June 25, 2019 at 242 Hoyt Street.

div.h3: 2019 Rooftop Party

div.p: Students and staff enjoyed the final days of the 2019 school year on the rooftop with a BBQ wrap up. Good luck with your final projects and on your Regents!

div.h3: Board Meeting - held Virtual by Zoom

div.div: The New Dawn Charter Schools Board of Trustees will be holding an additional Board meeting on Tuesday, April 7, at 3:00 p.m. The purpose of the meeting is to update everyone about the status of remote instruction and the upcoming holidays and spring break. The meeting will be held on Zoom and the information is:
Time: Apr 7, 2020 03:00 PM Eastern Time (US and Canada)

div.h3: Virtual Learning is in Session - Spring Break is Cancelled

div.p: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, we are open and available to students and staff via virtual learning on Thursday, April 9th and Friday, April 10th. Please take these days if you are observing the holidays, but remote instruction will continue.

Following the advice of the NYC Department of Education, we have cancelled Spring Break which was scheduled for was April 13-17, 2020. Staff and students are expected to maintain their assignments through remote instruction during this time.

div.h3: Update: Virtual Learning in Session - Spring Break is Canceled

div.p: Due to the ongoing global pandemic, we will remain open and be available to students and staff via virtual learning on Thursday, April 9th and Friday, April 10th. We are aware that these are religious days of observance, and encourage you to take these days if needed, but remote instruction will continue.

Following the advice of the NYC Department of Education, we have cancelled Spring Break which was scheduled for was April 13-17, 2020. Staff and students are expected to maintain their assignments through remote instruction during this time.

div.h3: Alternate Instruction and Updates

div.p: Beginning March 18, 2020, New Dawn Charter School will be meeting the needs of our students through alternate instruction and distance learning using Jupiter Ed.
All students are expected to complete assignments that teachers have posted for their classes.
Students and parents can access all updates and information on Jupiter, a link can be found here: Jupiter.
If you are having difficulty accessing a computer or hand-held device, you can use your PS4 or Xbox.
Youtube videos for how to get your internet browsers on PS4 can be found here and for Xbox One use the Microsoft Edge app and a video can be found here.
Please be safe, reach out to your teachers and mentors, and check back for updates. We miss you, and can't wait to see you soon.

div.h3: New Dawn Charter School's Spring College Fair

div.p: Students are invited to join us on Wednesday, March 11, 2020 in order to meet with top public and private colleges at our Spring College Fair.

div.h3: We're Hiring for Fall 2019

span.strong: Brooklyn and Queens Locations - Available Positions

div.p: Certified Teacher of Mathematics | Certified Teacher of Science | Certified Teacher of English Language Arts
Certified Teacher of Dual Language - Music and Arts | Aspiring Teachers | Certified School Guidance Counselor |Internship Coordinator
Visit our career page at http://www.ndchsbrooklyn.org/careers and submit cover letters and resumes to jobs@ndchsbrooklyn.org.

div.h3: Parent/Guardian Orientation and Teacher Conferences

div.p: Please join us for parent/guardian orientation, this is your opportunity to meet with your student's teachers, administration, and learn about the incredible growth we are sharing in as a community at New Dawn Charter Schools.

div.h3: Parent/Guardian Survey Announcement from the New York State Education Department - Charter School Office

div.p: Attention all parents and guardians! We need your participation in a survey about your experience with New Dawn Charter High School.
A link with a login and password will be sent in the mail, see the attached notice for more information.
If you are unable to access a computer, we are available Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. at 760 Dekalb Avenue, Brooklyn, New York 11216, and can provide access.

p.strong: This survey can ONLY be completed online. It will take approximately 10-15 minutes to complete and must be completed in one sitting, as you cannot save it and return to it later. Survey results are due to the CSO by 5:00 M on February 28, 2020.

li.a: The New York State Education Department Parent Survey Notice.docx

div.h3: Test

div.p: Test

strong.span: Due to the global pandemic, all Board meetings will be conducted virtually via Zoom. Board meetings are open to the public and we encourage our community to join us. Traditionally, our Board meets once a month, however during this time we have decided to hold more frequent opportunities to communicate and will be holding sessions every two weeks on Tuesdays. Please see the details and times provided below to join us:

div.div: The New Dawn Charter Schools Board of Trustees will be holding the next meeting on April 28, 2020 at 3:00 p.m. The purpose of this meeting will be for on-going status updates and open and consistent communication.
The meeting will be held on Zoom and the information for attending the meeting will be updated here frequently and prior to each meeting.

div.p: To all of our students, faculty, staff, parents and guardians we wish you a wonderful holiday.

All eligible 2020 Senior graduates are invited to join us for a breakfast celebrating their accomplishments. Students must participate in this event in order to receive all necessary paper work and caps and gowns for the day of graduation.
More details to come.
Please join us in celebrating and honor the achievements of our 2020 graduating class.
Congratulations to our students, faculty, staff, parents and guardians for another year together.

p.span: Dr. Sara Asmussen addresses students in a letter during the closure of schools in the City of New York. Please click here for its contents:

div.p: Please click the link below for more information about our Executive Director, and her origins and passions:

New Dawn Charter Schools will provide over-aged and under-credited students 15 - 21 years of age, including those who are English Language Learners and those with special needs, the opportunity to return to school and obtain a high school diploma through a rigorous NYSED standards-based education program.

p.span: Within the framework of the education program, three programs will be offered:

div.p: 1) Interventions for those with fewer than 11 credits, and for those with 11 or more credits
2) Internships in the community
3) College enrollment

p.a: Attention 🗣: Students are invited to participate in New Dawn’s College Fair next week! Meet college representatives from top public and private schools such as CUNY, St. Joseph’s, Vaughn College, the Brooklyn Educational Opportunity Center and many more! Find information about FAFSA and your next steps on this journey! #college #equity #fafsa #postsecondary

div.p: A post shared by New Dawn Charter HS - Bklyn (@ndcsbrooklyn) on Mar 6, 2020 at 8:43am PST
